name: CPOM retention
functionStatement: Organic matter is captured and broken down, fueling food webs, balancing production/ respiration, moderating pH/ redox, and supplying nutrients.
descriptionMarkdown: Leaf litter/coarse organic matter are visibly retained, supporting detrital processes per local references.
howToMeasureMarkdown: Count leaf packs and small debris dams, or infer retention from wood presence and low-velocity habitat during a field visit.

levels.label: Optimal
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Abundant CPOM retention with stable leaf packs typical for the system.

levels.label: Suboptimal
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Some retention but partially flushed out.

levels.label: Marginal
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Sparse organic matter and limited retention.

levels.label: Poor
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Essentially no retained organic matter, or severe overload causing anoxia risk.

references: planform complexity from imagery as supporting context.
